chess

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece

  • public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    A base class that implements a generic chess Piece. Chess Pieces such as rook, king, queen, etc. are all derived from this base. What makes each Piece different is the setting of its properties. For example, a pawn is only allowed to move up one square whereas a rook can move up to 7 squares.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Toni Au

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(Piece.Colors c,
             Piece.PieceNames n,
             java.lang.String squareName)
        A constructor to create a new game piece of a color and type and place it at a starting location on the game board.
        Parameters:
        c - Color of a new game piece (e.g. black or white)
        n - Name of a new game piece (e.g. rook, knight, etc.)
        squareName - Location (i.e. fileRank) to put this new game piece

        public boolean canMoveTo(java.lang.String newLoc)
        Verify that this piece is allowed to move to a specified location.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setTargets

        public void setTargets(java.util.ArrayList<FileRank> targets)
        Set an ArrayList of target location for this piece. This are locations on the game board where this piece is allowed to move to.

      • isPawnDoublePush

        public boolean isPawnDoublePush(java.lang.String targetLoc)
        Check if this is a pawn and is making an initial double push move. This check is part of the requirements to implement the En Passant capture move.
        Parameters:
        targetLoc - The new location where this pawn moves to
        Returns:
        Return "true" if this is an initial double push move by a pawn.
